title: Help! My Juniper is turning yellow!
content: Hi everyone, I'm new here. I got a Japanese Juniper a few weeks ago and some of the lower foliage is starting to turn yellow and feel brittle. I'm watering it every 2-3 days when the soil feels dry. It gets about 4 hours of direct sun. Any advice?

replies.content: Hi Bob, welcome! Yellowing on lower branches is sometimes normal as the tree sheds older foliage to focus on new growth. However, it can also be a sign of overwatering or underwatering. Does your pot have good drainage? Junipers also love full sun, so if you can give it more than 4 hours, that would be ideal.

I agree with David. I'd also check the soil moisture deeper down. Sometimes the top feels dry but the bottom is still soggy. A wooden chopstick is a great tool for this - stick it in, pull it out, and see if it's damp.
